content:
Add a Text Input Element to a FlexCard

From the Build panel, click Inputs, and drag the Text element onto the canvas. Update the element name in the Element Name field.

Configure properties common to all Input elements:
Bind the value of the input element to an existing or new data field.
Enter the label that appears next to the element.
Enter temporary text that displays inside the input field (Placeholder).
Check Required if the user must enter a value.
Check Read-only to disable modifying the input values.
Enter helpful text about the purpose of the input field (Help Text).
Select a default input value from a merge field or enter plain text (Default Value).
Provide an input mask that formats the data in a specific way (Mask).
Enter the minimum number of characters the user must enter (Minimum Length).
Enter the maximum number of characters the user can enter (Maximum Length).

Configure additional properties:
Click + Add New in the Custom Attributes section.
Select from an attribute dropdown and enter a value for the attribute.

Execute an action when interacting with the input element:
Click + Add Action to see Add a Click Event to a FlexCard Element.

Add conditions that must be met for the element to display:
See Add Conditions to a FlexCard Element.

Style the element:
Click Style to open the Style panel and see Style FlexCard Elements.
title: Adding Text Input Element to FlexCard
